result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon A Murrenus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 5/15/2015; alternate 20 days jail.
Defendant to have No Contact with Kohl's in the future.
Court waives the DNA sample and surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Shannon A Murrenus in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states all restitution has been paid and requests to enter a plea today. Court will pass the matter.   Amended Criminal Complaint filed. Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1.  Repeater allegation struck. Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- fine totaling $767.00 to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 05/15/2015; alternate 20 days jail
The Court waives the DNA sample and surcharge.
- Defendant to have NO contact with Kohl's in the future

Defendant Shannon A Murrenus in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant will not be retaining an Attorney at this time. Defendant has paid all restitution. State will amend to misdemeanor theft. Court will give another date in approximately 3 weeks.   Defendant may apply at Public Defender's Office for representation before the next date.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shannon A Murrenus in court.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant to pay restitution upfront and the state will amend to misd. charge. Time limits are tolled.  Hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Shannon A Murrenus
Current: N79 W25863 Plainview Road, Sussex, WI 53089-1434 United States  (Effective: 01-26-2015)
Prior: 12742 W Courtland Ave, Butler, WI 53007

Defendant Shannon A Murrenus in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not wish to get counsel, but would like to pay the restitution and would like more time to speak with the District Attorney. Court grants the adjournment request. Time limits are tolled.  Hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with any Kohls Department stores.   Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Shannon A Murrenus in court.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to seek counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.
